Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2010 11:25AM sandgrounder wrote: Hi, I am also from England, I was diagnosed with lung and lymph node mets in March 2009. I have just completed six cycles of Navelbine, I had c.t. scanafter 3 cycles and I had considerable reduction I have just had another after six and had considerable progression!! also large lump popped up under my arm which is a tumour! Hope to start Xeloda/Tyverb soon, waiting to see if we can get funding. Take care all, Janx
Posts.Title: Looking for my "Lung Mets" sisters.... WingsofHope grammadebbie

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2010 08:40PM sandgrounder wrote: Good luck Elaine! I am also waiting for scan results and I have had to wait two and a half weeks!! If the cancer doesn`t get me the stress will, I am normally a very level headed person but my mind has gone into overdrive. Do you have a b.c. nurse? I am in the U.K.and because of the level of stress that  scans cause me my onc. has agreed that my b.c. nurse can give me the results by phone, sadly for me she went on holiday the day after my last scan hence the state I am in!!  I have lung mets and have had four cycles of Vinoralbine, Capecetabine didn`t work well enough for me although my onc.said he might put me back on it at a later date. All will be revealed tomorrow thank goodness, is that when you get yours? Take care,Jan
Posts.Title: Scan time-again ElaineD Lowrider54

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2010 08:40PM sandgrounder wrote: So pleased for you Elaine, waiting is so hard, and to get a good result so worth it all!! I have also had a great result after 3 cycles of Navelbine, my report said I have a "significant reduction" to my lung mets.. I had progression all last year, so know just how you feel!! Take care,JanX
Posts.Title: Relieved at scan results! ElaineD MJLToday
